data.title: One of the best Chinese restaurants!
data.text: We have been there several times.  I love their combination Chow Fun.  The noodles are cooked just right and the flavors are very good.  I also love their War Won Ton soup.  It's always what I get when I have a cold.  Soothes the throat and taste delicious!  Definitely a fav of mine.

data.title: Chocolate Dipped Fortune Cookies...So you want more?
data.text:
This restaurant has always been a go-to place whenever we want good Chinese and in a clean, well-run establishment with bathrooms that aren't thru the kitchen...lol
We ordered one of our favs....Honey Walnut Prawns...it did not disappoint. The flavor was great and the quantity sufficient for two diners. It could have used more Walnuts...We also got another favorite....Cashew Chicken...Chicken wasn't tasty or with enough quantity...sorry...and there was little-to-no-sauce...The vegetables were cut into too large of pieces, except for the green beans which were fine as they were...Celery was too big for sure....Not enough Cashews.
Rice was steamed and just fine....We didn't order anything else. The Owner, Lawrence Wong....a name which I spelled correctly BTW....came by the table and sat with us for awhile, chatting about business etc....We enjoyed his company and the conversation...and...We weren't looking for free stuff. We also complimented Lawrence on the clean restaurant and noted that he was on top of that. We will be back...Next time....we'll ask for a Senior Discount...lol..
We loved the Chocolate Dipped Fortune Cookies....and thanks again to Lawrence for bringing me my glasses and our Left-Overs at the curb...We must have been so awe-struck by his demeanor that we simple forgot them on the table....

data.title: Good Choice
data.text: We were looking for a Chinese restaurant in Union City and decided to give this one a try.  It's clean and nicely decorated.  They have lunch specials Mon - Fri, and the food was good.  Husband had sweet and sour pork.  The pork was tender and lightly coated with breading.  I had kung pao prawns.  Asked them to hold the green peppers, and they did.  First time I've had it made with a sweet sauce, but I liked it. Staff were friendly and efficient.

data.title: Good atmosphere - Aok food
data.text:
We went there to celebrate Chinese New Year with friends who invited us to dinner.  We had not been there in many years.  There is a nice ambience to the place and we were looking forward to a delicious dinner and enjoyable evening.

We had the sizzling rice soup, appetizer plate, potstickers, salt and pepper pork chops, fried chicken, sizzling beef, honey walnut prawns, steamed rock cod, and dessert, their famous chocolate dipped fortune cookies!  All in all good food but too bad they forgot our chicken salad which our hosts raved about. Unfortunately, our hosts didn't remind them about their error so we didn't get to try it.  Best dishes were the honey walnut prawns, steamed rock cod and fortune cookies.  Wish the portions were a bit bigger because we were hungry and there were 7 of us eating family style.  But we were there to enjoy the company and our friends have been coming to this place since their children were babies.

data.title: Great chinese fusion
data.text: My wife came here for dinner and was very happy with the experience. Great chinese fusion and friendly waitresses. We were greeted immediately upon arrival and given a table by the window. Our orders came quickly except for the baby batchoy which unfortunately they said they ran out of.  Casual dining and customers vary in ethnicity. The owner walks around and says hi to some. Definitely recommend.

data.title: Good American style Chinese restaurant
data.text: used to work down the street from Rose Garden, and have eaten here maybe a 100 times. For a standard American style Chinese restaurant I feel it is above average. I wouldn't drive too far to eat here, but it is overall pretty good. I recommend the spicy beef w/ broccoli, the chicken salad & the hot & sour soup. The noodle dishes are nothing special.

data.title: Middle of the road Chinese food
data.text: Had the lunch, Kung Pao prawns. Different take on Kung Pao. Also the prawns and mixed vegetables; this was a better choice. Chow mein was ok. Service was also average.
